intro: [WRONG START] Embilia boivinii, commonly known as the African star anise, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped flowers and small, dark purple berries. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach a height of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are glossy and elliptical, while its bark is smooth and reddish-brown. The berries are often used in traditional medicine for their aromatic and medicinal properties.
